entry.title: Books for fans of character-driven novels
entry.summary: I like a fast-paced thriller as much as the next person, but sometimes I’m in the mood for something quieter. Then I reach for a contemplative, character-driven novel, and this year I read several I recommend.

entry.title: Downtown college housing is in preliminary stages
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — Umpqua Community College is working on three different housing projects in downtown Roseburg and hopes to have those ready for students by next school year, according to a presentation held Wednesday at the UCC board meeting.

entry.title: Elementary school students learn about veterans, honor
entry.summary: GREEN — As Green Elementary School’s student body recited the pledge of allegiance in the school’s courtyard Thursday morning, veterans were brought to tears watching the next generation honor them for their service.

entry.title: OBSERVED VETERANS DAY FRIDAY
entry.summary: November 10, 2023 3:50 a.m. Since the holiday falls on the weekend, Friday is the government observance of Veterans’ Day. That means federal, state, county, and city offices are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. Schools are not in session. However, most banks and credit unions will be open. Many professional offices are closed....

entry.title: 'Honored to serve,' Nick Marshall retires after 22 years
entry.summary: Empathy for his fellow humans. Respect for those who served before him. An ever growing love for his community. This is what Nick Marshall gleaned from his 22 year career with the Oregon Army National Guard.

entry.title: Sutherlin man still missing after a week
